action.content:
You are participating in a collaborative guessing game.
The goal is to find out whether this picture and another picture only I can see, are the same.
Please describe your image first. Then, I will provide my description and we can ask each other questions about the images to figure out whether they are the same. Now start your short image description with "DESCRIPTION:" followed by the description. Do not add anything else.
DESCRIPTION: Two people in wetsuits are standing on a beach, facing the ocean. One is holding a surfboard, and the other has a bodyboard on the sand. The ocean waves are visible in the background.

You are participating in a collaborative guessing game.
The goal is to find out whether this picture and another picture only I can see, are the same.
Please describe your image first. Then, I will provide my description and we can ask each other questions about the images to figure out whether they are the same. Now start your short image description with "DESCRIPTION:" followed by the description. Do not add anything else.
DESCRIPTION: Two people in wetsuits are standing on a beach, facing the ocean. One is holding a surfboard, and the waves are crashing onto the shore. The sky is overcast.

This is my DESCRIPTION: Two people in wetsuits are standing on a beach, facing the ocean. One is holding a surfboard, and the other has a bodyboard on the sand. The ocean waves are visible in the background.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Is the sky overcast in your image?

This is my DESCRIPTION: Two people in wetsuits are standing on a beach, facing the ocean. One is holding a surfboard, and the waves are crashing onto the shore. The sky is overcast.
QUESTION: Is the sky overcast in your image? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Is there a bodyboard on the sand in your image?

ANSWER: Yes.
QUESTION: Is there a bodyboard on the sand in your image? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are both people looking towards the ocean in your image?

ANSWER: Yes.
QUESTION: Are both people looking towards the ocean in your image? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Is one of the people holding a surfboard under their arm in your image?

ANSWER: Yes.
QUESTION: Is one of the people holding a surfboard under their arm in your image? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Is the sand in your image dark or light in color?

ANSWER: Yes.
QUESTION: Is the sand in your image dark or light in color? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are the waves in your image large and crashing?

ANSWER: Dark.
QUESTION: Are the waves in your image large and crashing? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.

Now come to a decision. What do you think: are your picture and the other picture described the same picture?  Write "DECISION: same image" if you think they are the same picture or "DECISION: different images" if you think they are different pictures. Do not add anything else.
